title: Explosion
data:
An **explosion** results from the use, or misuse, of certain items or from some [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap"). Most items that can explode are magical. Most explosions will cause [damage](/wiki/Damage "Damage") to the adventurer or monster that provokes them; some explosions can cause damage in the surrounding [squares](/wiki/Square "Square") as well.

Some types of explosions are listed here.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Dark explosion](#Dark_explosion)
- [2 Noxious explosion](#Noxious_explosion)
- [3 Muddy explosion](#Muddy_explosion)
- [4 Wet explosion](#Wet_explosion)
- [5 Magical explosion](#Magical_explosion)
- [6 Fiery explosion](#Fiery_explosion)
- [7 Frosty explosion](#Frosty_explosion)

## Dark explosion

Dark explosions have [tiles](/wiki/Tileset "Tileset") assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

## Noxious explosion

A noxious explosion results from a [gas spore](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore") bursting. It does physical damage to any nearby creature; the gas spore itself dies in the process.

## Muddy explosion

Muddy explosions have [tiles](/wiki/Tileset "Tileset") assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

## Wet explosion

Wet explosions have [tiles](/wiki/Tileset "Tileset") assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

## Magical explosion

Magical explosions result from the destruction of a [magic trap](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap") or from attempting to place a [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation"), [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"), or [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks") into a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"). Magical explosions that cause damage to nearby [squares](/wiki/Square "Square") result from breaking most types of [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand").

Magical explosions do magical damage to creatures without [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## Fiery explosion

A fiery explosion results from any of these acts:

- breaking a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")
- casting the [fireball](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball") spell; causes multiple explosions if at [skilled](/wiki/Skill "Skill") or better
- throwing a burning [potion of oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil")
- dipping a lit [lamp](/wiki/Lamp "Lamp") into a potion of oil
- reading a [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire"); does damage to surrounding [squares](/wiki/Square "Square") if blessed

Fiery explosions do [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage to creatures without [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), destroy [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") and [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"), and melt [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice").

## Frosty explosion

A frosty explosion results from breaking a [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold") or from casting [cone of cold](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cone_of_cold "Spellbook of cone of cold") at [Skilled](/wiki/Skill "Skill") or better. All such explosions damage surrounding [squares](/wiki/Square "Square"). Frosty explosions do [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") damage to creatures without [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), destroy [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), and freeze [water](/wiki/Water "Water") and [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Explosion

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

An explosion results from the use, or misuse, of certain items or from some traps. Most items that can explode are magical. Most explosions will cause damage to the adventurer or monster that provokes them; some explosions can cause damage in the surrounding squares as well.

Some types of explosions are listed here.

Contents

  • 1 Dark explosion
  • 2 Noxious explosion
  • 3 Muddy explosion
  • 4 Wet explosion
  • 5 Magical explosion
  • 6 Fiery explosion
  • 7 Frosty explosion

Dark explosion

Dark explosions have tiles assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

Noxious explosion

A noxious explosion results from a gas spore bursting. It does physical damage to any nearby creature; the gas spore itself dies in the process.

Muddy explosion

Muddy explosions have tiles assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

Wet explosion

Wet explosions have tiles assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

Magical explosion

Magical explosions result from the destruction of a magic trap or from attempting to place a wand of cancellation, bag of holding, or bag of tricks into a bag of holding. Magical explosions that cause damage to nearby squares result from breaking most types of wands.

Magical explosions do magical damage to creatures without magic resistance.

Fiery explosion

A fiery explosion results from any of these acts:

  • breaking a wand of fire
  • casting the fireball spell; causes multiple explosions if at skilled or better
  • throwing a burning potion of oil
  • dipping a lit lamp into a potion of oil
  • reading a scroll of fire; does damage to surrounding squares if blessed

Fiery explosions do fire damage to creatures without fire resistance, destroy potions, scrolls and spellbooks, and melt ice.

Frosty explosion

A frosty explosion results from breaking a wand of cold or from casting cone of cold at Skilled or better. All such explosions damage surrounding squares. Frosty explosions do cold damage to creatures without cold resistance, destroy potions, and freeze water and lava.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
An '''explosion''' results from the use, or misuse, of certain items or from some [[trap]]s.  Most items that can explode are magical.  Most explosions will cause [[damage]] to the adventurer or monster that provokes them; some explosions can cause damage in the surrounding [[square]]s as well.

Some types of explosions are listed here.

==Dark explosion==
Dark explosions have [[tileset|tile]]s assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

==Noxious explosion==
A noxious explosion results from a [[gas spore]] bursting.  It does physical damage to any nearby creature; the gas spore itself dies in the process.

==Muddy explosion==
Muddy explosions have [[tileset|tile]]s assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

==Wet explosion==
Wet explosions have [[tileset|tile]]s assigned to them, but are nowhere invoked in the program.

==Magical explosion==
Magical explosions result from the destruction of a [[magic trap]] or from attempting to place a [[wand of cancellation]], [[bag of holding]], or [[bag of tricks]] into a [[bag of holding]].  Magical explosions that cause damage to nearby [[square]]s result from breaking most types of [[wand]]s.

Magical explosions do magical damage to creatures without [[magic resistance]].

==Fiery explosion==
A fiery explosion results from any of these acts:
* breaking a [[wand of fire]]
* casting the [[fireball]] spell; causes multiple explosions if at [[Skill|skilled]] or better
* throwing a burning [[potion of oil]]
* dipping a lit [[lamp]] into a potion of oil
* reading a [[scroll of fire]]; does damage to surrounding [[square]]s if blessed

Fiery explosions do [[fire]] damage to creatures without [[fire resistance]], destroy [[potion]]s, [[scroll]]s and [[spellbook]]s, and melt [[ice]].

==Frosty explosion==
A frosty explosion results from breaking a [[wand of cold]] or from casting {{spell of|cone of cold}} at [[Skill]]ed or better.  All such explosions damage surrounding [[square]]s.  Frosty explosions do [[cold]] damage to creatures without [[cold resistance]], destroy [[potion]]s, and freeze [[water]] and [[lava]].
